intro: Cymopterus davidsonii, commonly known as Davidson's evening-primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by moths and other nocturnal insects. Cymopterus davidsonii is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
